pageContext.claim: “We had a deal for some DACA — for a lot of things. But we had a deal done and I said to people when that case was lost — well, it wasn't lost permanently, I think we're going to ultimately win — that’s the time I want to talk about it.”
pageContext.analysis: Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer met with Trump in early September 2017 and then announced they had a tentative deal that extended DACA but did not fund the border wall. Trump took a beating from his right-wing supporters after that announcement, and days later tweeted that there was no deal with Pelosi and Schumer. No judge had ruled to uphold DACA in the interim.
